action.content: Turn 0

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the table, the book on the table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a wardrobe, a pillow and a bed. The wardrobe is closed. The pillow is on the bed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
> take pillow
Turn 1
You take the pillow. In your inventory you have a pillow.
> open wardrobe
Turn 2
The wardrobe is now open. The wardrobe is empty.
> go to hallway
Turn 3
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a living room, a bedroom, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
> go to living room
Turn 4
You are in a living room now. There are a book, a side table, a couch, a chair, a table and a shelf. The book is on the side table. There is a passage to a hallway here.
> take book
Turn 5
You take the book. In your inventory you have a pillow and a book.
> go to kitchen
Turn 6
You can't go to a kitchen from here.
> go to hallway
Turn 7
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a living room, a bedroom, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
> go to kitchen
Turn 8
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a cupboard and a plate. The cupboard is closed. The plate is on the counter. There are passages to a pantry and a hallway here.
> take plate
Turn 9
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
> drop pillow
Turn 10
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
> put pillow on floor
Turn 11
You can't see a floor here.

> put pillow on counter
> take plate
